text: hi welcome to the AWS cost optimization
Series today we're going to talk about
AWS budgets
[Music]
because budgets is the simplest way to
monitor your AWS spend and be alerted
when you exceed or are forecasted to
exceed your desired spending limit you
can use AWS budgets to track and take
action on your AWS costs and usage you
can use AWS budgets to monitor your
aggregate utilization and coverage
metrics for legal Reserve instances or
saving plans AWS budgets help us to
enable simple to complex costs and usage
tracking for example setting a monthly
cost budget with a fixed Target amount
to track all costs associated with your
account you can create the following
types of budget cost budgets to plan how
much you want to spend on a service
usage budgets to plan how much you want
to use on one or more services Reserve
instances utilization budgets to define
a utilization threshold and receive
alerts when you reserve instances usage
faults below that threshold and saving
plan utilization budget to define a
utilization threshold and receive alerts
when the usage of your saving plans
Falls below that threshold as well let's
have a look on the console we need to
look for that service we can type
budgets
on the search bar budgets let's click
the first option
and we can create a budget directly
it's very simple
we can use a template or customize the
type of alert we want to receive let's
keep this simple using a template
we can select three types of templates
series spend budget monthly cost budget
or daily saving plans
with zero spend budget we can create a
budget that notify us once our spending
exceeds AWS free tier limits in case we
are new in AWS we want to take advantage
on this
template
we can Define here a budget name
and we need to add the email recipient
so let's add
an email
all the services are scope in this
budget so we will be notified via email
when any spend is incurred
